quest.name: Pedal to the Metal
journal: Nonowato longs to live in a world where he is able to simply ask you to do some mining.

Nonowato greets you once again by dangling the prospect of a mining job in front of you before cruelly snatching it away. It seems yet another fight has broken out at the Bangpots and Stickqix would appreciate your help. You hurry to the manufactory with Nonowato to see exactly what is going on.

You find Stickqix in the midst of longing for simpler times when his work was seldom interrupted by infighting. He explains that Stackblox and Zansei have been arguing over the design of the Gobroller's controls. You agree to play mediator once more and go to talk with the two workers.

If there is one thing Stickqix's workers are not lacking, it is passion. Zansei and Stackblox have been locked in a heated debate about whether the Gobroller's controls should be made to accommodate men or goblins. Having ascertained their respective positions, you are now ready to fill Stickqix in on the situation.

You explain the cause of the quarrel to Stickqix and he asks that you obtain feather iron ore on his behalf. You are told that his merchant friend will be able to explain where you are to begin the search. You head for the Hard Place wondering just who Stickqix's friend is exactly.

After arriving at the Hard Place you are greeted by a familiar gobbieface, one that has helped you before. Remembering your past favor, the goblin merchant tells you the location of the mineral you seek free of charge. You prepare yourself for the long journey to Hells' Lid all in the good name of technological innovation.

Stickqix shows the minerals he requested to Zansei and Stackblox in the hope that it might get their creative juices flowing. Sadly, neither of them are able to grasp what he is suggesting and Stickqix is forced to spell things out: Zansei and Stackblox must work together using the fruits of your labor to create controls which suit all races.

You speak with Stickqix once more. He has been troubled enough by the recent disharmony that he is considering asking an old friend, Slowfix, for advice on how to proceed. Not wishing to weigh you down with such heavy thoughts, he bids you head outside and join Nonowato, who has been patiently waiting for you.

Nonowato thanks you again for your efforts while apologizing that he was unable to do more himself. He suggests you use the time you have before the next job to rest up and hone your mining skills.

※The next miner quest will be available from Nonowato upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Mine feather iron ore in Hells' LidDeliver the chunks of feather iron ore to Stickqix.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text:
Forename, the time has come for your next mining job.
...Is what I would be saying to you right now if we lived in a perfect world.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Yet another fight has broken out in the manufactory. Hurry, we've wasted enough time already!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: The chief can explain the situation much better than I!

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Just as work on the armor was starting to pick up, someone else had to go and start a fight.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: That blasted goblin girl understands nothing! Nothing, you hear me!?

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I wonder if this infernal heat has anything to do with the frequent fights of late... Do not misunderstand me, they can beat each other to a pulp for all I care, but I would rather they did it in their own time.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Zansei is too addlebrained to sweatwork with Stackblox! Stackblox has the best knowings to fancycraft Gobroller insides!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Ah, adventurer. I was just recalling a time when my work used to be so enjoyable, absent of any petty squabbles.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Alas, that was long ago. My workers are at it once again. This time it's Zansei and Stackblox who are quarreling over the Gobroller's controls.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Oh, my braincase aches so...

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... My apologies. I have a nasty habit of slipping back into gobbiespeak when vexed.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: I am ashamed to ask this of you once more, but could you talk to the two of them? You did great work before and I cannot think of any other way to solve this.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Talk to Zansei and Stackblox and see if you cannot get to the bottom of what's ailing them.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: We're so sorry for dragging you into this a second time!

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: You want to know why I am fighting with Stackblox? Oh, it would be my pleasure to tell you! She wants to design the controls to be Hyur-friendly. Can you believe that?

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Any imbecile knows that goblins are best suited to operate such machinery and the Gobroller will be no exception! What sense does it make to design the controls for races that are hardly going to use the thing?

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: No work will be done until she acknowledges the error of her ways! Although, I wonder if someone that deluded is capable of such a thing.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox wants to design whirlycog insides for uplanders, but Zansei says no!

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Zansei has much knowings of whirlycogs. Why won't he make Gobroller insides that suit uplanders?

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Stackblox can't sweatwork with these addlebrained ideas! Zansei needs to think like gobbie!

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: It is in the name: Gobroller. If we were developing some kind of Auri-roller then maybe I would have cause to think differently.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... If Zansei were a gobbie he would be Slowthinx Nothoughts!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... I know that can't have been easy. On the bright side, now that we know the issue, all we need do is fix it!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Would you be able to bring me twenty chunks of feather iron ore, old girlold boy?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Splendid!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: My friend, a merchant of sorts, is more knowledgeable of this particular mineral than I. Seek him out at the Hard Place and he shall tell you where to find what we need.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... You will find my friend at the Hard Place.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Please, Forename! Those minerals are the key to solving this dispute, I am sure of it.

dialogue.name: GOBLINMERCHANT02556
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... You are the uplander that gave gobbie ore more precious than jinglyshine! Good gobbiefriend, indeed! Are you well?

dialogue.name: GOBLINMERCHANT02556
dialogue.text: Searching for feather iron ore? Gobbie is always willing to aid Stickqix's busydeals! Uplander is good gobbiefriend so no jinglyshine is needed.

dialogue.name: GOBLINMERCHANT02556
dialogue.text: You will find what you seek in the Far East! Head for the Ruby Sea.

dialogue.name: GOBLINMERCHANT02556
dialogue.text:
Pssshkoh...
Uplander must go to Ruby Sea for minerals.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Was my merchant friend able to point you in the right direction?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Perfect! The quality is even better than the last batch you delivered. Nonowato, fetch Zansei and Stackblox for me.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox ear-catches that Stickqix wants to trade tongueflaps with gobbie. But why is Zansei here?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Take a look at this before you get too riled up.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: By the Twelve! I have never seen a mineral quite like this in my life.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox does not see this in Eorzea. Where did uplander find it?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... We had our miner friend travel all the way to the Far East to retrieve this for us. Once smelted, it can be used to create metal as light as a feather...well, almost.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Use this to create the vehicle's controls and I am certain the decrease in weight will enable you two to design something very special indeed.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Chief, I have not the foggiest idea what you are saying.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Look, both of your attitudes are perfectly logical. But this is Idyllshire─a place where goblins and men live in harmony! Are you telling me that our work should not reflect that?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Why not make two sets of interchangeable pedals for the Gobroller? One would be of a suitable size for goblins, Lalafells, and other smaller races. The other would account for the realm's larger races.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: I am positive that if the two of you work together, you have the potential to create controls convenient for all races. I would not have bothered to request our miner friend's help otherwise.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Chief Stickqix is best gobbie! Two braincases are better than one.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: It is hard to admit, but I was indeed in the wrong. Come on, Stackblox, let us start a mechanical revolution!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Yet again you have saved the day! My thanks, Forename.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Excellent work today, as always! Let's head outside to discuss your next job.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Yes, I'd like to believe there actually will be a next job...

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: What's that? Something the chief said is bothering you?

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Looks like everything's in order once more. Frankly, I was getting tired of waiting; it's high time I was getting back to my own work.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: My apologies for involving you in all of that. I shall make amends by creating Gobroller controls which push the very boundaries of control technology to their utmost limits!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I see the fighting seems to have died down at last. Hopefully there will not be any further distractions. We are all here for one very specific purpose after all.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox is sorry for wasting uplander's time. But gobbie gives wordbond that whirlycog insides will be perfect!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Mayhap I ought to consult with Slowfix about this...

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: I just feel that something needs be done to improve our working conditions. We can't very well expect to finish this project in a timely manner if we're bickering every step of the way. It also will not do to rely on your help forever.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: I have the utmost confidence in the ability of every single one of my workers; I just wish I could stop worrying about their personalities. If only there was some way they could all work in harmony...

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Ah, sorry, old girlold boy! This is nothing for you to concern yourself with. Go and speak with Nonowato, he's been waiting more than long enough.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Pay no heed to what I just said─consider them the musings of an easily worried goblin.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you once again for all your hard work! I'd love to say this will be the last time we require your problem-solving talents, but recent events make me somewhat doubtful.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I wish I could have helped myself, but someone in my position really needs to remain neutral during times like these.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I wouldn't imagine we will be requiring your services─mining or otherwise─in the immediate future, so do take this chance to rest up.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To be deleted.
